issue.subject: OTP : Very very long password
issue.description:
When allowing one-time password feature, the autogenerated password is a 128 characters string. Is it really necessary ?

__I tested it and when copying the password by selecting it with a double-clic, it added an extra "space" at the end to the string which leads to wrong password copied in the interface.
I happens to me... and may happen to others as well._ 

Thomas, why not considering a shorter password to avoid this kind of "problem" ?

journals.notes:
*Bonus proposal* : could you "trim":http://php.net/manual/fr/function.trim.php the white spaces before hashing the user-provided password ?
This would avoid windows copy-pastry fails (white space selected before or after the password received in the mail).
We could also add a parameter to define the password length
